sen.j: 中村 一氏（なかむら かずうじ）は安土桃山時代の大名。
sen.e: Kazuuji NAKAMURA was a Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Kazuuji NAKAMURA was a Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Kazuuji NAKAMURA was a Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.j: 豊臣政権の三中老の一人。
sen.e: He was one of Sanchuro (arbitration office) of the Toyotomi government.
He was one of Sanchuro (arbitration office) of the Toyotomi government.
He was one of Sanchuro (arbitration office) of the Toyotomi government.

tit.e: Chronological list of the main events
Chronological list of the main events
Chronological list of the main events

sen.j: 生年未詳：近江国甲賀（現・滋賀県甲賀郡）出身とされる。
sen.e: Year of birth unknown: He is regarded to have come from Koga in the Omi Province (present Koka County, Shiga Prefecture).
Year of birth unknown: He is regarded to have come from Koga in the Omi Province (present Koka County, Shiga Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペース削除しました。
sen.e: Year of birth unknown: He is regarded to have come from Koga in the Omi Province (present Koka County, Shiga Prefecture).

sen.j: 甲賀二十一家の1つ、瀧（多喜）氏の出と考えられる。
sen.e: He is considered to have been from the Taki clan, one of the Koga-nijyuikke (the 21 clans of Goga).
He is considered to have been from the Taki clan, one of the Koga-nijyuikke (the 21 clans of Koga).
He is considered to have been from the Taki clan, one of the Koga-nijyuikke (the 21 clans of Koga).

sen.j: はやくから豊臣秀吉（豊臣秀吉）に仕えた。
sen.e: He served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI from early on.
He served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI from early on.
He served Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI from early on.

sen.j: 天正元年（1573年）頃秀吉より近江長浜のうち200石を拝領する。
sen.e: Around 1573, he was granted by Hideyoshi 200 Koku crop yields out of Nagahama, Omi Province.
Around 1573, he was granted by Hideyoshi 200 Koku crop yields out of Nagahama, Omi Province.
Around 1573, he was granted by Hideyoshi 200 Koku crop yields out of Nagahama, Omi Province.

sen.j: 天正5年（1577年）：天王寺を攻略､石山本願寺門跡派の一揆を鎮圧。
sen.e: 1577: He overran Tenno-ji Temple and suppressed an uprising by the Monzeki sect of Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple.
1577: He overran Tenno-ji Temple and suppressed an uprising by the Monzeki sect of Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple.
1577: He overran Tenno-ji Temple and suppressed an uprising by the Monzeki sect of Ishiyama Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 天正10年（1582年）：山崎の戦いに鉄砲隊を指揮して武功をたてる。
sen.e: 1582: He rendered distinguished military service taking command of a firearms troop in the Battle of Yamazaki.
1582: He rendered distinguished military service taking command of a firearms troop in the Battle of Yamazaki.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: 1582: He rendered distinguished military service taking command of a firearms troop in the Battle of Yamazaki.

sen.j: 天正11年（1583年）：賤ヶ岳の戦いに参戦。
sen.e: 1583: He participated in the Battle of Shizugatake.
1583: He participated in the Battle of Shizugatake.
1583: He participated in the Battle of Shizugatake.

sen.j: 岸和田城主となり3万石を拝領する。
sen.e: He became the lord of the Kishiwada Castle and was granted 30,000Koku crop yields.
He became the lord of the Kishiwada-jo Castle and was granted 30,000 koku crop yields.
sen.cmt: Kishiwada-joに訂正しました、スペース補足しました。koku小文字にしました。
sen.e: He became the lord of the Kishiwada-jo Castle and was granted 30,000 koku crop yields.

sen.j: 天正13年（1585年）：近江国水口岡山城主になり6万石を拝領する。
sen.e: 1585: He became the lord of the Minakuchi-okayama Castle in Omi Province and was granted 60,000 Koku crop yields.
1585: He became the lord of the Minakuchi-Okayama-jo Castle in Omi Province and was granted 60,000 koku crop yields.
sen.cmt: Minakuchi-Okayama-joに訂正しました。koku小文字にしました。
sen.e: 1585: He became the lord of the Minakuchi-Okayama-jo Castle in Omi Province and was granted 60,000 koku crop yields.

sen.j: 従五位下式部少輔に叙任。
sen.e: He was promoted and appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial).
He was promoted and appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial).
He was promoted and appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial).

sen.j: 天正18年（1590年）：北条征伐において豊臣秀次隊の先鋒を務め、ほぼ単独で松田康長の守る山中城の主要部分を攻略。
sen.e: 1590: He lead the van of the troop of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI in an expedition against Hojo and captured almost unassisted the main part of the Yamanaka-jo Castle defended by Yasunaga MATSUDA.
1590: He lead the van of the troop of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI in an expedition against Hojo and captured almost unassisted the main part of the Yamanaka-jo Castle defended by Yasunaga MATSUDA.
1590: He lead the van of the troop of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI in an expedition against Hojo and captured almost unassisted the main part of the Yamanaka-jo Castle defended by Yasunaga MATSUDA.

sen.j: 功により駿河国駿府14万石を拝領する。
sen.e: He was granted 140,000 Koku crop yields in Sunpu in Suruga Province in recognition of his distinguished military service.
He was granted 140,000 koku crop yields in Sunpu in Suruga Province in recognition of his distinguished military service.
He was granted 140,000 koku crop yields in Sunpu in Suruga Province in recognition of his distinguished military service.

sen.j: 文禄4年（1595年）：駿河直領（蔵入地）の代官として駿河を任される。
sen.e: 1595: He was entrusted to rule Suruga Province as Daikan (local governor) of Suruga Jikiryo (directly-controlled land).
1595: He was entrusted to rule Suruga Province as Daikan (local governor) of Suruga Jikiryo (directly-controlled land).
1595: He was entrusted to rule Suruga Province as Daikan (local governor) of Suruga Jikiryo (directly-controlled land).

sen.j: 慶長3年（1598年）：三中老の一人に任命される。
sen.e: 1598: He was appointed one of Sanchuro (arbitration office).
1598: He was appointed one of Sanchuro (arbitration office).
1598: He was appointed one of Sanchuro (arbitration office).

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）：関ヶ原の戦いでは東軍に属すが、合戦前の7月17日（8月25日）に病没。
sen.e: 1600: He belonged to the Eastern Camp in the Battle of Sekigahara, but on August 25 before the battle started, died of illness.
sen.cmt: 「慶長5年7月17日」＝グレゴリオ暦西暦1600年8月25日 」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: 1600: He belonged to the Eastern Camp in the Battle of Sekigahara, but on August 25 before the battle started, died of illness.
1600: He belonged to the Eastern Camp in the Battle of Sekigahara, but on August 25 before the battle started, died of illness.

sen.j: 合戦には弟の中村一栄が出陣した。
sen.e: It was Kazuhide NAKAMURA who went into battle.
It was Kazuhide NAKAMURA who went into battle.
It was Kazuhide NAKAMURA who went into battle.

sen.j: 戒名は大竜院殿一源心公大禅定門。
sen.e: His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist names) was
sen.cmt: 「大竜院殿一源心公大禅定門」の読み方不明のため、入力いたしませんでした。
sen.e: His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist names) was Dairyu-in den Ichigenshin Kodai Zenteimon.
sen.cmt: Dairyu-in den Ichigenshin Kodai Zenteimon読み方不明の為、推測しました。
sen.e: His Kaimyo (posthumous Buddhist names) was Dairyu-in den Ichigenshin Kodai Zenteimon.

sen.j: 墓は静岡市の臨済寺 (静岡市)にある。
sen.e: His tomb is located at Rinzai-ji Temple in Shizuoka City.
His tomb is located at Rinzai-ji Temple in Shizuoka City.
His tomb is located at Rinzai-ji Temple in Shizuoka City.

sen.j: 家督を継いだ長男の中村一忠も東軍に属し、美濃表で大いに戦った。
sen.e: His eldest son Icchu NAKAMURA who succeeded his father as the head of the family actively fought in Mino region.
His eldest son Icchu NAKAMURA who succeeded his father as the head of the family actively fought in Mino region.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。
sen.e: His eldest son Icchu NAKAMURA who succeeded his father as the head of the family actively fought in Mino region.

sen.j: 戦後、その戦功によって伯耆国米子藩17万5,000石および国持大名の格式を与えられたが、慶長14年（1609年）に中村一忠は急死。
sen.e: After the battle, Icchu NAKAMURA was granted 175,000 Koku crop yields in Yonago Domain in Hoki Province and the status of Kunimochi-daimyo (a daimyo having domain of one province or more) in recognition of his distinguished military service, however, suddenly died in 1609.

After the battle, Icchu NAKAMURA was granted 175,000 koku crop yields in Yonago Domain in Hoki Province and the status of Kunimochi-daimyo (a daimyo having domain of one province or more) in recognition of his distinguished military service, however, suddenly died in 1609.

After the battle, Icchu NAKAMURA was granted 175,000 koku crop yields in Yonago Domain in Hoki Province and the status of Kunimochi-daimyo (a daimyo having domain of one province or more) in recognition of his distinguished military service, however, suddenly died in 1609.

sen.j: 跡継ぎを欠いた中村家はわずか2代で断絶。
sen.e: Without heir, the Nakamura family died out with only two generations.
Without heir, the Nakamura family died out with only two generations.
Without heir, the Nakamura family died out with only two generations.

sen.j: 江戸幕府により改易された。
sen.e: The family was deprived of its status and forfeited the family territories.
The family was deprived of its status and forfeited the family territories.
The family was deprived of its status and forfeited the family territories.

sen.j: 一忠の側室(梅里)が男子(中村一清)を産んでいるが、末期養子の認められない時代であり、また、将軍に拝謁を済ませるなど認知を受けてもおらず、跡目としては認められなかった。
sen.e: Although a concubine (Bairi) of Icchu gave birth to a son (Kazukiyo NAKAMURA), he was not recognized as an heir, in view of the time when a Matsugo yoshi (adopted as a son on one's deathbed) was not accepted and also in view of the fact that he was not received in audience by Shogun and not obtained Shogun's acknowledgment.

Although a concubine (Bairi) of Icchu gave birth to a son (Kazukiyo NAKAMURA), he was not recognized as an heir, in view of the time when a Matsugo yoshi (adopted as a son on one's deathbed) was not accepted and also in view of the fact that he was not received in audience by Shogun and not obtained Shogun's acknowledgment.

Although a concubine (Bairi) of Icchu gave birth to a son (Kazukiyo NAKAMURA), he was not recognized as an heir, in view of the time when a Matsugo yoshi (adopted as a son on one's deathbed) was not accepted and also in view of the fact that he was not received in audience by Shogun and not obtained Shogun's acknowledgment.

sen.j: 一清は後に鳥取藩主池田光仲に仕え、禄高150石で鳥取藩家老池田知利の客分となる。
sen.e: Kazukiyo later served Mitsunaka IKEDA, the lord of the Tottori Domain and became a guest of Tomoyoshi IKEDA, Karo (Chief retainer) of Tottori Domain getting Rokudaka (amount of stipend) of 150 Koku crop yields.

Kazukiyo later served Mitsunaka IKEDA, the lord of the Tottori Domain and became a guest of Tomoyoshi IKEDA, Karo (Chief retainer) of Tottori Domain getting Rokudaka (amount of stipend) of 150 Koku crop yields.
sen.cmt: koku 小文字にしました。
sen.e: Kazukiyo later served Mitsunaka IKEDA, the lord of the Tottori Domain and became a guest of Tomoyoshi IKEDA, Karo (Chief retainer) of Tottori Domain getting Rokudaka (amount of stipend) of 150 Koku crop yields.

sen.j: 岸和田城主時代の天正12年（1584年）、雑賀・根来衆に攻められ、居城岸和田城が落城寸前に追い込まれた（岸和田合戦）際、大蛸に乗った僧と数千の蛸に城を救われたという伝説（蛸地蔵伝説）がある。
sen.e: In 1584 when he was the lord of the Kishiwada-jo Castle where he usually resided, the castle was attacked by Saikashu and Negoroshu (a group of armed priests in Negoro-ji Temple) and driven to the brink of surrender (the Battle of Kishiwada), and there is a legend that at that time a priest riding on a large octopus and thousands of octopus came and rescued the castle from danger (Legend of Octopus Jizo).

In 1584 when he was the lord of the Kishiwada-jo Castle where he usually resided, the castle was attacked by Saikashu and Negoroshu (a group of armed priests in Negoro-ji Temple) and driven to the brink of surrender (the Battle of Kishiwada), and there is a legend that at that time a priest riding on a large octopus and thousands of octopus came and rescued the castle from danger (Legend of Octopus Jizo).

In 1584 when he was the lord of the Kishiwada-jo Castle where he usually resided, the castle was attacked by Saikashu and Negoroshu (a group of armed priests in Negoro-ji Temple) and driven to the brink of surrender (the Battle of Kishiwada), and there is a legend that at that time a priest riding on a large octopus and thousands of octopus came and rescued the castle from danger (Legend of Octopus Jizo).

sen.j: 近江源氏佐々木氏の族山崎氏の余流、桓武平氏良文流、藤原氏流、橘氏流とする説があるが、正確には不明である｡
sen.e: According to several theories, his origins include a branch line of the Yamazaki clan of the Omi Genji Sasaki clan, the Yoshifumi line of the Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan), a line of the Fujiwara clan or a line of the Tachibana clan, it is, however, unknown to be precise.

According to several theories, his origins include a branch line of the Yamazaki clan in Sasaki family of Omi-Genji (Minamoto clan), the Yoshifumi line of the Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan), a line of the Fujiwara clan or a line of the Tachibana clan, it is, however, unknown to be precise.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。in Sasaki family of Omi-Genji (Minamoto clan)に訂正しました。
sen.e: According to several theories, his origins include a branch line of the Yamazaki clan in Sasaki family of Omi-Genji (Minamoto clan), the Yoshifumi line of the Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan), a line of the Fujiwara clan or a line of the Tachibana clan, it is, however, unknown to be precise.

sen.j: 『米子市史』には、数種類ある中村氏にみられるルーツ(源氏末裔、平氏末裔説等)は不確定的要素が多く、歴史的事実とみなすことはできないが、一忠の父・一氏以降の系譜は信頼性が高いとしている。
sen.e: According to "History of Yonago City," several roots of the Nakamura clan (theories including descendants of the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan) contain many uncertain elements and can't be regarded as historical facts, however, the family tree from Kazuuji, Icchu's father and after is highly reliable.

According to "History of Yonago City," several roots of the Nakamura clan (theories including descendants of the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan) contain many uncertain elements and can't be regarded as historical facts, however, the family tree from Kazuuji, Icchu's father and after is highly reliable.

According to "History of Yonago City," several roots of the Nakamura clan (theories including descendants of the Minamoto clan and the Taira clan) contain many uncertain elements and can't be regarded as historical facts, however, the family tree from Kazuuji, Icchu's father and after is highly reliable.

sen.j: 鳥取藩士中村家の末裔義和所有の系図は、350年以上が経過していることが鑑定により明らかである。
sen.e: The family tree owned by Yoshikazu, a descendant of the Nakamura family, clansman of Tottori Domain clearly indicated in an appraisal that it was prepared more than 350 years before.
The family tree owned by Yoshikazu, a descendant of the Nakamura family, clansman of Tottori Domain clearly indicated in an appraisal that it was prepared more than 350 years before.
The family tree owned by Yoshikazu, a descendant of the Nakamura family, clansman of Tottori Domain clearly indicated in an appraisal that it was prepared more than 350 years before.

sen.j: 一氏の父は吉一としており、系図には多くの文献で一氏の父とされている一政という名は見出せない。
sen.e: In the family tree, the father of Kazuuji is Yoshiichi, and there is no mention of Ichimasa who is regarded as the father of Kazuuji in many literatures.
In the family tree, the father of Kazuuji is Yoshiichi, and there is no mention of Ichimasa who is regarded as the father of Kazuuji in many literatures.
In the family tree, the father of Kazuuji is Yoshiichi, and there is no mention of Ichimasa who is regarded as the father of Kazuuji in many literatures.

sen.j: 『駿国雑志』には｢中村一氏は尾州中村(現・愛知県名古屋市中村区)の住人中村孫平次一政の子なり。
sen.e: "Sunkoku-zasshi" mentioned that 'Kazuuji NAKAMURA was a child of Nakamura Magoheiji Kazumasa, a resident of Nakamura, Bi-shu (Owari Province) (present Nakamura Ward, Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 「駿国雑志」の読みは、下記サイトから引用しました。http://porta.ndl.go.jp/Result/R000000008/I000033747
sen.e: "Sunkoku-zasshi" mentioned that 'Kazuuji NAKAMURA was a child of Nakamura Magoheiji Kazumasa, a resident of Nakamura, Bi-shu (Owari Province) (present Nakamura Ward, Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture).
"Sunkoku-zasshi" mentioned that 'Kazuuji NAKAMURA was a child of Nakamura Magoheiji Kazumasa, a resident of Nakamura, Bi-shu (Owari Province) (present Nakamura Ward, Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture).

sen.j: 本姓詳ならず(本姓不明)｣とある。
sen.e: Main name was not detailed (Main name was unknown).'
Main name was not detailed (Main name was unknown).'
Main name was not detailed (Main name was unknown).'

sen.j: 『滋賀県甲賀郡誌』には、｢中村一氏は弥平次一政の子にして初め瀧孫平次と称し後、中村式部少輔とあらたむ｡瀧村の人なり｣とある
sen.e: "History of Koka County, Shiga Prefecture" mentions that 'Kazuuji NAKAMURA, a child of Yaheiji Kazumasa, first called himself as Heiji TAKIMAGO and changed the name to Nakamura Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial). He was a person of Takimura.'
sen.cmt: 「瀧孫平次」の読みは、用語集、サイトにも見当たらず、定かではありません。
sen.e: "History of Koka County, Shiga Prefecture" mentions that 'Kazuuji NAKAMURA, a child of Yaheiji Kazumasa, first called himself as Magoheiji TAKI and changed the name to Nakamura Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial). He was a person of Taki Village.'
sen.cmt: Magoheiji TAKI に訂正しました。Taki Villageに訂正しました。
sen.e: "History of Koka County, Shiga Prefecture" mentions that 'Kazuuji NAKAMURA, a child of Yaheiji Kazumasa, first called himself as Magoheiji TAKI and changed the name to Nakamura Shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial). He was a person of Taki Village.'

sen.j: 『近江與地志略』には、｢一氏は佐々木山崎の余流にして此の地多喜の産なり｡｣とある。
sen.e: "Omi Yochishiryaku" mentioned that 'Kazuuji was on a branch line of Sasaki Yamazaki and was born in this place, Taki.'
sen.cmt: 「近江與地志略」の読みは、下記サイトから引用いたしました。http://www.nagahamashi.org/sengoku/map_new/kohoku01.html
sen.e: "Omi Yochishiryaku" mentioned that 'Kazuuji was on a branch line of Yamazaki clan in Sasaki family and was born in this place, Taki.'
sen.cmt: on a branch line of Yamazaki clan in Sasaki family前出より訂正しました。
sen.e: "Omi Yochishiryaku" mentioned that 'Kazuuji was on a branch line of Yamazaki clan in Sasaki family and was born in this place, Taki.'

sen.j: 子・中村甚左衛門
sen.e: Son: Jinzaemon NAKAMURA.

sen.j: 細川幽斎に仕える。
sen.e: He served Yusai HOSOKAWA.
He served Yusai HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いにおける田辺城 (丹後国)籠城（田辺城の戦い）では、皇居への使いという密命を受け田辺城を脱出した（「中村甚左衛門田辺御籠城御使者一件」参照）。
sen.e: At the time of a siege in the Tanabe-jo Castle (Tango Province) (the Battle of Tanabe-jo Castle) in the Battle of Sekigahara, he got a secret order to be a messenger to the Imperial Palace and escaped from the Tanabe-jo Castle (Refer to 'Jinzaemon NAKAMURA as a messenger from a siege in the Tanabe-jo Castle').

At the time of a siege in the Tanabe-jo Castle (Tango Province) (the Battle of Tanabe-jo Castle) in the Battle of Sekigahara, he got a secret order to be a messenger to the Imperial Palace and escaped from the Tanabe-jo Castle (Refer to 'Jinzaemon NAKAMURA as a messenger from a siege in the Tanabe-jo Castle').

At the time of a siege in the Tanabe-jo Castle (Tango Province) (the Battle of Tanabe-jo Castle) in the Battle of Sekigahara, he got a secret order to be a messenger to the Imperial Palace and escaped from the Tanabe-jo Castle (Refer to 'Jinzaemon NAKAMURA as a messenger from a siege in the Tanabe-jo Castle').

sen.j: 孫・中村弥一
sen.e: Grandchild: Yaichi NAKAMURA
Grandchild: Yaichi NAKAMURA

sen.j: 甚左衛門の子。
sen.e: Child of Jinzaemon
He was a child of Jinzaemon.

sen.j: 細川忠興の命により「沢村」に改姓、細川家家老沢村大学一門と同様の処遇を受けた。
sen.e: He changed his family name to 'Sawamura' by the order of Tadaoki HOSOKAWA and was given equal treatmentto the family of Daigaku SAWAMURA, Karo (chief retainer) of the Hosokawa family.

sen.j: 曾孫・中村正辰（熊本藩士）
sen.e: Great-grandchild: Masatatsu NAKAMURA (feudal retainer of the Kumamoto clan).
Great-grandchild: Masatatsu NAKAMURA (feudal retainer of the Kumamoto clan).
Great-grandchild: Masatatsu NAKAMURA (feudal retainer of the Kumamoto clan).

sen.j: 熊本藩主加藤忠広に仕え500石、改易後に新藩主細川忠利に仕え1,000石。
sen.e: He served Tadahiro KATO, the lord of the Kumamoto Domain receiving 500 Koku crop yields and after Kaieki (change of rank) served Tadatoshi HOSOKAWA, the new lord of the Domain receiving 1,000 Koku crop yields.

sen.j: 勘三郎
sen.e: Kanzaburo NAKAMURA
Kanzaburo NAKAMURA
Kanzaburo NAKAMURA

sen.j: 一氏の末弟・中村右近（蜂須賀家5,000石）の孫。
sen.e: He was a grandchild of Ukon NAKAMURA (the Hachisuka family with 5,000 Koku crop yields), the youngest brother of Kazuuji.
He was a grandchild of Ukon NAKAMURA (the Hachisuka family with 5,000 koku crop yields), the youngest brother of Kazuuji.

sen.j: 歌舞伎江戸三座の一つ中村座の座元・中村勘三郎 (初代)と同一人物とする説もあるが明確ではない。
sen.e: There is a theory that he was the same person as Kanzaburo NAKAMURA (the First), Zamoto (leader of a theatrical company) of Nakamura-za Theater, one of the Edo Sanza of Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors), however, it is not certain.
